title: Spatial and Fixture Designer
summary: Apple’s Industrial Design team is looking for a Spatial and Fixture Designer with experience in both architecture and industrial design. This role will focus on two areas: Fixtures, involving how our products are displayed in all Apple stores and third party partners, and secondly Spatial, overseeing design of new construction and modifications of design studios.
description:
Our ID team designs all of our products and is heavily involved in manufacturing, packaging, and retail representation in stores as well. The Retail Designer will work with design leads on presentation and fixtures used to display our product on store tables, window displays and at launch events. They will drive the collaboration with Product Marketing, Visual Merchandising, Retail engineering, and Marcom teams for these projects. This unique position is critical to ensure that our products are represented in the best possible way in our stores and at launch events.

The Architecture aspect of this role manages the design of our studio locations. These are highly creative spaces, often with unique finishes and bespoke elements, facilitating the team to achieve their best work. This role helps ensure those unique needs are met by working closely with Apple’s Real Estate and Development team to drive complex construction projects, space redesigns, and the design of custom furniture while maintaining aesthetic continuity.
key_qualifications:
Developing initial product, architecture, and new technology concept investigations through sketching, model building or renderings
Ability to read architectural plans
Experience and interest in working with designers and creative visionaries
Comfort with ambiguity and strong ability to self-direct
education_experience:
Degree in Industrial Design or equivalent degree
5+ years relevant experience
additional_requirements: Portfolio PDF required. Please send to designrecruiting@apple.com with “Spatial and Fixture Designer” in the subject line.
